result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A. Medellin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Miguel A. Medellin in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT229, 15CM517, 15FO558, 15FO559 and 16CM245.

10:15 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT229:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM517:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

15FO558:
Count 1 - DRI

15FO559:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CM245:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CT229, Count 1 & 2 on 15CM517 and Count 1 of 15FO559 and Count 1 & 2 on 16CM245 are DRI and Count 1 of 15FO558 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT229:
Count 1 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan

15CM517:
Count 1 -
Pay $150 fine plus costs
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
10 days jail - all 10 days can be served on electronic home monitor, if approved and accepted
Eligible for huber priveleges
Jail sentence to be transferred to Fond Du Lac County
Report to jail today for start date
60 days to commence jail sentence
Count 2 -
Pay $50 fine plus costs 

15FO558:
Count 1 - DRI

15FO559:
Count 1 -
Pay forfeiture/costs totalling $389.50 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan

16CM245:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
